basics.name: Emily Zhixuan Zeng
basics.label: PhD Student in Vision and Image Processing
basics.summary: PhD student in Vision and Image Processing at the University of Waterloo, specializing in computer vision, explainable AI, and machine learning. Extensive internship experience in computer vision applications across various industries.

work.name: NVIDIA
work.summary: Incorporated synthetic data for training lane detection models.
highlights: Developed data pipeline and experimented with synthetic data incorporation.
Resolved critical failure scenarios blocking PathNetV4 release.
Developed tools to better visualize and identify challenging scenarios.

work.name: NVIDIA
work.summary: Time series light signal detection for autonomous vehicles.
highlights: Defined labelling guidelines and potential model architectures.
Trained proof of concept classification network using public data.

work.name: Miovision
work.summary: Traffic data analysis with computer vision.
highlights: Led project to introduce active learning techniques to data ingest pipeline.
Optimized selection of images for labeling from large unlabelled pool.
42% improvement in mean average precision between models.

work.name: Synapse Technology
work.summary: Developed and analyzed CNN models for detecting threats in security x-ray scans.
highlights: Developed fine grain rotational data augmentation method.
Significantly improved model performance in underrepresented classes.

work.name: Praemo
work.summary: Used LSTM to detect anomalies in time series vibration data and predict machine failure in industrial robots.

work.name: ESI
work.summary: Robotic navigation using reinforcement learning and IR sensors.
highlights: 95% success rate in simulation and 85% success rate on physical robot.

education.area: Vision and Image Processing Lab, supervised by Dr. Alexander Wong
Vision and Image Processing Lab, supervised by Dr. Alexander Wong

awards.title: Finalist at 2022 IEEE International Conference on Automation Science and Engineering

publications.name: Decoding Diffusion: A Scalable Framework for Unsupervised Analysis of Latent Space Biases and Representations Using Natural Language Prompts
publications.summary: Measuring biases and visualizing concept clusters through sampling from the H-Space in diffusion models

publications.name: ShapeShift: Superquadric-based Object Pose Estimation for Robotic Grasping
publications.summary: A paper on superquadric-based object pose estimation for robotic grasping presented at the CVPR 2023 WICV workshop.

publications.name: Explaining Explainability: Towards Deeper Actionable Insights into Deep Learning through Second-order Explainability
publications.summary: A study on deep learning explainability presented at the CVPR 2023 XAI4CV workshop.

publications.name: MetaGraspNet: A Large-Scale Benchmark Dataset for Vision-driven Robotic Grasping via Physics-based Metaverse Synthesis
publications.publisher: 2022 IEEE International Conference on Automation Science and Engineering
publications.summary: Research on a large-scale benchmark dataset for robotic grasping presented at the 2022 IEEE International Conference on Automation Science and Engineering.

publications.name: COVID-Net US-X: Enhanced Deep Neural Network for Detection of COVID-19 Patient Cases from Convex Ultrasound Imaging Through Extended Linear-Convex Ultrasound Augmentation Learning
publications.summary: Development of an enhanced deep neural network for COVID-19 detection from ultrasound imaging, presented at the CVPR 2022 WICV workshop.

projects.name: AUTOREAD
projects.description: Text to speech model for fiction novels trained using automatically labeled audiobook dataset.
